thread.section_title: News Article Archive from M03 22, 2018 - Wsj.com
thread.title: How Hotels are Upping the Ante on In-Room Entertainment

author: Matthew Kronsberg
title: How Hotels are Upping the Ante on In-Room Entertainment
text:
BOREDOM, WROTE poet Joseph Brodsky, is “your window on time’s infinity, which is to say, on your insignificance in it.” It’s unclear whether he was staying in a Holiday Inn while formulating this bleak insight, but, given how boring hotel rooms can be, it seems entirely possible.
Lately, hotels have been going to greater lengths to keep us entertained. After all, when restlessness sets in, bad things can happen. Just ask Golden State Warriors star Stephen Curry, whose recent en-suite golf swing practice inadvertently demolished...
